org.unc.lac.javapetriconcurrencymonitor.petrinets.components

Class PetriNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.unc.lac.javapetriconcurrencymonitor.petrinets.components.PetriNode
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Place, Transition

    public abstract class PetriNode
extends java.lang.Object
    Since a PetriNet is a bipartite graph, a PetriNode is a node connectable by an arc. Therefore PetriNode must be extended by Place and Transition. This class generalizes a few methods needed by a a node of that graph.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Returns:
        Id used to identify univocally the node

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        Returns:
        Index used either as row or column index for the petri matrixes

      • setIndex

        public void setIndex(int _index)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the id for this PetriNode. This should be used before creating the petri matrices and during PNML parsing to avoid mismatching index and column/row when some index is missing in the PNML
        Parameters:
        _index - the new index. Must be positive
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when _index is negative

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        Get the custom name given by the petri net creator
